I just spotted a country called Greenland that's the  size of Africa and has 57,000 people living there. Will it be habitable with the coming  temperature rises?

And this video explains why I've decided not to have children. It's almost cruel at this point to bring new humans into the world. I don't want to be blamed by my own child for bringing them into what's likely effectively the twilight years of human life on this planet.

I don't see the "world's leaders" fixing this issue. They haven't held themselves to ANY of their previous promises, why would they start now? Most of them will be dead before the worst hits us. Why would they care what future generations think of them if they're not around to suffer the consequences themselves?

I miss having hope for the future.

1.5C around 2032, 2C around 2045, and everybody has chosen 2050 to become zero C02! If it wasn't so scary, it would be funny. But "cities in rich countries may be OK".... Followed by:        "rural areas will suffer more". Where do you think the food is grown that city dwellers eat?!
